title: Revamp Vault gallery: larger cards, improved styling, richer motion

requirements.text: Redesign the Vault overview gallery (VaultPage) so photo cards/thumbnails are significantly larger on mobile and no longer feel cramped (e.g., fewer columns, larger tile sizes, improved spacing, and clearer hierarchy between month header and grid).

quotes: the vault is really lacking and the cards are way to smalll..and not styled visually well.. also not motion..

acceptanceCriteria: Vault overview thumbnails render at a noticeably larger size than the current 3-column grid (current code uses `grid grid-cols-3 gap-2`).
The Vault overview remains mobile-first and fits within the existing fixed viewport frame (max 390x844) without horizontal overflow.
Month grouping remains intact and still supports navigating to an individual moment by tapping a thumbnail.

requirements.text: Improve the visual styling of Vault overview cards/tiles to feel more premium and intentional (refine surface treatment, borders/shadows, corner radius, and typography consistency) while keeping the current appâ€™s warm/beige baseline background.
acceptanceCriteria: Vault thumbnail tiles have updated styling that is visually distinct from the current `.vault-thumbnail-tile` look and reads as a cohesive card system.
Typography for Vault headers/labels is consistent and uses the existing app font family (Bricolage Grotesque).
Styling changes are implemented via Vault-specific classes/components (no requirement to change backend behavior).

requirements.text: Add richer motion to the Vault experience: smoother entrance animations for month sections and tiles, improved tap/press feedback on tiles, and a more polished transition feel when navigating into and out of the moment viewer (VaultMomentPage).
acceptanceCriteria: Month sections animate in smoothly as they enter the viewport (building on the existing `useInView` usage and `.vault-month-section` / `.vault-month-visible`).
Vault tiles provide clear tap/press feedback (scale/opacity/shadow changes) that feels responsive on mobile.
Entering the moment viewer and returning to the Vault feels intentionally animated (e.g., backdrop/image/overlay animations) and does not introduce navigation glitches.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend immutable paths (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep backend architecture unchanged (single Motoko actor); this Vault revamp should be frontend-only unless strictly necessary.
nonGoals: Do not add new backend storage, indexing, or syncing for Vault moments as part of this request.
Do not introduce third-party animation libraries; use existing CSS/Tailwind/React patterns already in the codebase.
Do not change the camera capture flow or photo storage schema as part of the Vault styling/motion upgrade.
